solution_line_template: First find the number of new vampires after one night: {people_turned_per_vampire_per_night} people/vampire * {initial_vampires} vampires = <<{people_turned_per_vampire_per_night}*{initial_vampires}={new_vampires_night1}>>{new_vampires_night1} people

Add that to the starting number of vampires to find the total number of vampires after one night: {new_vampires_night1} vampires + {initial_vampires} vampires = <<{new_vampires_night1}+{initial_vampires}={total_vampires_after_night1}>>{total_vampires_after_night1} vampires

Then find the number of new vampires on the second night: {people_turned_per_vampire_per_night} people/vampire * {total_vampires_after_night1} vampires = <<{people_turned_per_vampire_per_night}*{total_vampires_after_night1}={new_vampires_night2}>>{new_vampires_night2} people

Add that number to the starting number of vampires on the second night to find the total number of vampires after two nights: {new_vampires_night2} vampires + {total_vampires_after_night1} vampires = <<{new_vampires_night2}+{total_vampires_after_night1}={total_vampires_after_night2}>>{total_vampires_after_night2} vampires
